column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2021
Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
column14: Downloaded the required app and required phone camera and full time location services to be enabled.  Why buy a dash cam if I need to enable the camera on my phone? Why do you need my location when I’m not using the cam or the app, why do you need my mobile #? Why do you need to send me notifications constantly. I’ll pass, sending back this big brother in a box.

column6: stopped working after the first month
column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2020
column14: I bought this camera after watching some videos on social media, liking the idea that I would have proof if I were ever in an accident.  Well, wouldn't you know it, it worked great for the first month, then I noticed it would intermittently work the next month.  Yesterday, I was hit when an idiot decided to pass me on the right and cut in front of me, and the camera failed to capture any of it, just when I needed it most.  Will toss it and get something rated better.

column6: Software and product is total garbage!!!!!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020
column14: Not sure what the point of this camera even is. It claims to be automatic. But it doesn’t ever actually save drives. Just the route. Why would I buy a dash cam to save the route I took? I want it to save the drive. I don’t want it to delete. I want it to save every single second until the memory is full and overlaps. Big scam energy. God forbid I actually got into an accident and I was counting on footage to save my ass. I’d be absolutely screwed!!!! (EDIT: everyone saying that all footage is backed up onto SD CARD IS LYING!!! There is nothing but bits and pieces of random sections of my drives!!!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
column14: My car cigarette lighter outlet is always powered on, so I was concerned about forgetting to turn off the camera and running the battery dead. Turns out, the camera will turn off on its own after a certain amount of inactivity. It also turns on and records on its own, but it usually doesn’t start until about 5 minutes of driving. Nexar says they’re working on that. So far, I’ve remembered to turn it on most of the time.

column6: Great Phone Features and Hands-Off Approach
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
column14: My wife and I had a couple of dash cams and we hated having to take the memory card out and download the videos. We wanted something we never had to touch and would sync with our phones and this device covered every base. It does ask for a lot of phone permissions so if you're the type that values your privacy heavily this may give you some unease. However my wife and I are OK given the features and the hands-off nature. You can keep your phone in your pocket or purse and the camera will record no problem and if something was to happen you can go back and save a specific clip or it will also automatically record hard brakes or accidents.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2020
column14: I have had different dashboard camera's before. This one is the the most expensive one I bought so far and it has been worth every penny. As far as installation, it was very easy to stick it to my windshield with the suction cup. I loved that it came with cord clips to tie up the cord around your car. I spent a good 30 minutes stringing the cord throughout my windshield and under the passenger seat so the cord wasn't in the way when I am driving. As long as it has a power source, it turns on when the car turns on, making it very worry free.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020
column14: This product is awesome and is great for anyone with a smart phone. Usually dash cams save all footage on a memory card but this one saves all footage on your phone making it really easy to access any footage you might want to check out. It’s easy to install and the wires are easy to hide. The quality is very good when it’s recording and your able to see the license plate of cars in front of you.
